sentences: Maria Frances Parke (26 August 1772 – 31 July 1822) was an English soprano, pianist and composer of keyboard works.
Her father was the oboist John Parke, while her uncle was the oboist and composer William Thomas Parke.
She made her debut as a pianist and singer at the age of nine.
At ten she performed a Clementi duet with Maria Hester Park née Reynolds (1760–1813), with whom she is sometimes confused.
A Divertimento and Military Rondo for the Piano
Grand Sonata in F Major for Solo Piano
Grand Sonata in E-flat Major for Solo Piano
Grand Sonata in D Major for Solo Piano
